title: Cargo Build Error for Foundry-evm
body:
### Component

Other (please describe)

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

source = "git+https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry.git#94777647f6ea5d34572a1b15c9b57e35b8c77b41

### What command(s) is the bug in?

cargo build

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

I created a new cargo project and added the following dependencies in `Cargo.toml`

```toml
[package]
name = "foundry-test"
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2021"

# See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html

[dependencies]
foundry-evm = { git = "https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry.git" }
```

When I run `cargo build`, I get the following error:

```
Compiling foundry-evm v0.2.0 (https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry.git#94777647)
error[E0283]: type annotations needed
  --> ~/.cargo/git/checkouts/foundry-f7cca724e93059b0/9477764/evm/src/fuzz/strategies/int.rs:33:46
   |
33 |         let new_mid = self.lo + interval / 2.into();
   |                                          -   ^^^^
   |                                          |
   |                                          type must be known at this point
   |
   = note: cannot satisfy `_: Into<ethers::types::I256>`
   = note: required for `ethers::types::I256` to implement `std::ops::Div<_>`
help: try using a fully qualified path to specify the expected types
   |
33 |         let new_mid = self.lo + interval / <i32 as Into<T>>::into(2);
   |                                            +++++++++++++++++++++++ ~

error[E0283]: type annotations needed
  --> ~/.cargo/git/checkouts/foundry-f7cca724e93059b0/9477764/evm/src/fuzz/strategies/int.rs:72:60
   |
72 |         self.lo = self.curr + if self.hi < 0.into() { (-1).into() } else { 1.into() };
   |                             -                              ^^^^
   |                             |
   |                             type must be known at this point
   |
   = note: cannot satisfy `_: Into<ethers::types::I256>`
   = note: required for `ethers::types::I256` to implement `std::ops::Add<_>`
help: try using a fully qualified path to specify the expected types
   |
72 |         self.lo = self.curr + if self.hi < 0.into() { <i32 as Into<T>>::into((-1)) } else { 1.into() };
   |                                                       +++++++++++++++++++++++    ~

error[E0283]: type annotations needed
   --> ~/.cargo/git/checkouts/foundry-f7cca724e93059b0/9477764/evm/src/fuzz/strategies/int.rs:122:30
    |
122 |             1 => -offset - 1.into(),
    |                          -   ^^^^
    |                          |
    |                          type must be known at this point
    |
    = note: cannot satisfy `_: Into<ethers::types::I256>`
    = note: required for `ethers::types::I256` to implement `std::ops::Sub<_>`
help: try using a fully qualified path to specify the expected types
    |
122 |             1 => -offset - <i32 as Into<T>>::into(1),
    |                            +++++++++++++++++++++++ ~

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0283`.
error: could not compile `foundry-evm` due to 3 previous errors
```

I am running macOS Apple Silicon, but I am seeing the same error in building on Ubuntu in a remote docker builder instance. I can bisect and see which commit broke this and/or work on a solution, but I want to first verify that I am not the only user seeing this compilation issue.

Digging deeper, this seems to be using an incorrect (more recent) version of the ethers-rs dep. Since this package isn't on crates.io, I believe it's giving cargo more leeway to choose different cargo.lock versions.
Lots of futzing around later, this is due to not adding `Cargo.lock` into my `Dockerfile` which changed due to ethers-rs pushing a new build today.
